standard_metadata.standard_description: Use place value understanding to round decimals to any place.

question.content: Zach's pet mouse drinks $1.084$ milliliters of water each week.  **Round the amount of water to the nearest hundredth.**    milliliters

hints.content: To help us round, let's place $1.084$ on a number line between the nearest hundredths.    $1.0\blueD84$ has $\blueD8$ hundredths so it would come between $1.08$ and $1.09$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 1.08 to 1.09.

hints.content: The number $1.084$ has less than $5$ thousandths, so it is to the left of the midpoint.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 1.08 to 1.09 with tick marks every five thousandths units.  A point labeled 1.084 appears on the number line between 1.08 and 1.085, closer to 1.085.

hints.content: Since $1.084$ is closer to $1.08$, it would round to $1.08$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 1.08 to 1.09 with tick marks every five thousandths units.  A point labeled 1.084 appears on the number line between tick mark 1.08 and an unlabeled tick mark representing 1.085. An arrow begins at the point 1.084 and moves left to tick mark 1.08.

hints.content: The amount of water rounded to the nearest hundredth is $1.08$ milliliters.

question.content: Eliza's pet snail traveled $2.197$ meters in one day.  **Round the distance to the nearest hundredth.**    meters

hints.content: To help us round, let's place $2.197$ on a number line between the nearest hundredths.    $2.1\blueD97$ has $\blueD9$ hundredths so it would come between $2.19$ and $2.20$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 2.19 to 2.2.

hints.content: The number $2.197$ has more than $5$ thousandths, so it is to the right of the midpoint.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 2.19 to 2.2, with a tick mark every 5 thousandths units. A point labeled 2.197 appears between tick mark 2.195 and tick mark 2.2, slightly closer to 2.195.

hints.content: Since $2.197$ is closer to $2.2$, it would round to $2.2$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 2.19 to 2.2, with a tick mark every 5 thousandths units. A point labeled 2.197 appears between an unlabeled tick mark representing 2.195 and tick mark 2.2.  An arrow begins at the point 2.197 and moves right to tick mark 2.2.

hints.content: The distance rounded to the nearest hundredth is $2.20$, or $2.2$ meters.

question.content: Joey used $0.432$ pounds of cheese to make mac-and-cheese for dinner.  **Round the amount of cheese to the nearest tenth.**    pounds

hints.content: To help us round, let's place $0.432$ on a number line between the nearest tenths.    $0.\blueD432$ has $\blueD4$ tenths so it would come between $0.4$ and $0.5$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.4 to 0.5.

hints.content: The number $0.432$ has less than $5$ hundredths, so it is to the left of the midpoint.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.4 to 0.5, with a tick mark every 5 hundredths units. A point labeled 0.432 appears on the number line between 0.4 and 0.45, slightly closer to 0.45.

hints.content: Since $0.432$ is closer to $0.4$, it would round to $0.4$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.4 to 0.5, with a tick mark every 5 hundredths units. A point labeled 0.432 appears on the number line between 0.4 and 0.45, slightly closer to 0.45. An arrow begins at the point 0.432 and moves left to tick mark 0.4.

hints.content: The amount of cheese rounded to the nearest tenth is $0.4$ pounds.

question.content: At a car racing track, the speed of one car was recorded as $170.55$ miles per hour.  **Round the speed to the nearest tenth.**    miles per hour

hints.content: To help us round, let's place $170.55$ on a number line between the nearest tenths.    $170.\blueD55$ has $\blueD5$ tenths so it would come between $170.5$ and $170.6$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 170.5 to 170.6.

hints.content: The number $170.55$ has exactly $5$ hundredths, so it is right on the midpoint. We round numbers that are exactly in the middle to the higher value.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 170.5 to 170.6, with a tick mark every five hundredths units. A point labeled 170.55 appears on the tick mark 170.55.

hints.content: Since $170.55$ is closer to $170.6$, it would round to $170.6$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 170.5 to 170.6, with a tick mark every five hundredths units. A point labeled 170.55 appears on an unlabeled tick mark halfway between tick mark 170.5 and tick mark 170.6. An arrow begins at the point 170.55 and moves right to tick mark 170.6.

hints.content: The speed of the race car rounded to the nearest tenth is $170.6$ miles per hour.

question.content: One scientific team determined that the average thickness of a chicken's egg shell is $0.311$ millimeters.  **Round the thickness of the shell to the nearest tenth.**    millimeters

hints.content: To help us round, let's place $0.311$ on a number line between the nearest tenths.    $0.\blueD311$ has $\blueD3$ tenths so it would come between $0.3$ and $0.4$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.3 to 0.4.

hints.content: The number $0.311$ has less than $5$ hundredths, so it is to the left of the midpoint.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt:
A number line labeled 0.3 to 0.4 with tick marks every
five hundredths units. A point labeled 0.311 appears on the number line between 0.3 and 0.35, closer to 0.3.

hints.content: Since $0.311$ is closer to $0.3$, it would round to $0.3$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt:
A number line labeled 0.3 to 0.4 with tick marks every
five hundredths units. A point labeled 0.311 appears on the number line between 0.3 and an unlabeled tick mark representing 0.35. An arrow begins at the point 0.311 and moves left to tick mark 0.3.

hints.content: The thickness of the shell rounded to the nearest tenth is $0.3$ millimeters.

question.content: At a frisbee-throwing competition, one contestant threw a frisbee $113.47$ meters.  **Round the distance to the nearest meter.**    meters

hints.content: To help us round, let's place $113.47$ on a number line between the nearest ones.    $11\blueD3.47$ has $\blueD3$ ones so it would come between $113$ and $114$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled with 113 to 114.

hints.content: The number $113.47$ has less than $5$ tenths, so it is to the left of the midpoint.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled with 113 to 114, with a tick mark every five tenths units.  A point labeled 113.47 appears on the number line between 113 and 113.5, closer to 113.5.

hints.content: Since $113.47$ is closer to $113$, it would round to $113$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 113 to 114, with a tick mark every five tenths units.  A point labeled 113.47 appears on the number line between 113 and an unlabeled tick mark representing 113.5. An arrow begins at the point at 113.47 and moves left to tick mark 113.

hints.content: The distance rounded to the nearest meter is $113$ meters.

question.content: Some queen bumblebees weigh up to $0.85$ grams.  **Round the weight to the nearest gram.**    gram(s)

hints.content: To help us round, let's place $0.85$ on a number line between the nearest ones.    $\blueD0.85$ has $\blueD0$ ones so it would come between $0$ and $1$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 1.

hints.content: The number $0.85$ has more than $5$ tenths, so it is to the right of the midpoint.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 1 with tick marks every one-half unit. A point labeled 0.85 appears between tick mark 0.5 and tick mark 1.

hints.content: Since $0.85$ is closer to $1$, it would round to $1$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 1 with tick marks every one-half unit. A point labeled 0.85 appears between an unlabeled tick mark representing 0.5 and tick mark 1. An arrow begins at the point 0.85 and moves right to tick mark 1.

hints.content: The weight rounded to the nearest gram is $1$ gram.

question.content: Cassandra spends $6.75$ hours each day at school.  **Round the amount of time to the nearest hour.**    hours

hints.content: To help us round, let's place $6.75$ on a number line between the nearest ones.    $\blueD6.75$ has $\blueD6$ ones so it would come between $6$ and $7$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 6 to 7.

hints.content: The number $6.75$ has more than $5$ tenths, so it is to the right of the midpoint.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 6 to 7 with tick marks every one-half unit. A point labeled 6.75 appears between tick mark 6.5 and tick mark 7.

hints.content: Since $6.75$ is closer to $7$, it would round to $7$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 6 to 7 with tick marks every one-half unit. A point labeled 6.75 appears between an unlabeled tick mark representing 6.5 and tick mark 7. An arrow begins at the point 6.75 and moves right to tick mark 7.

hints.content: The amount of time rounded to the nearest hour is $7$ hours.

question.content: Sasha has been saving the money she earns from babysitting for several months. She has a total of  $\$96.75$ saved.  **Round the amount of money to the nearest ten.**    dollars

hints.content: To help us round, let's place $96.75$ on a number line between the nearest tens.    $\blueD96.75$ has $\blueD9$ tens so it would come between $90$ and $100$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 90 to 100.

hints.content: The number $96.75$ has more than $5$ ones, so it is to the right of the midpoint.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 90 to 100, with a tick mark every 5 units. A point labeled 96.75 appears on the number line between 95 and 100, closer to 95.

hints.content: Since $96.75$ is closer to $100$, it would round to $100$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 90 to 100, with a tick mark every 5 units. A point labeled 96.75 appears on the number line between an unlabeled tick mark representing 95 and tick mark 100. An arrow begins at the point 96.75 and moves right to tick mark 100.

hints.content: The amount of money rounded to the nearest ten is $\$100$.

question.content: The total amount of money raised to buy new playground equipment at Yasmin's school is $\$2{,}329.48$.  **Round the amount of money to the nearest hundred.**     dollars

hints.content: To help us round, let's place $2{,}329.48$ on a number line between the nearest hundreds.    $2{,}\blueD329.48$ has $\blueD3$ hundreds so it would come between $2{,}300$ and $2{,}400$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 2300 to 2400.

hints.content: The number $2{,}329.48$ has less than $5$ tens, so it is to the left of the midpoint.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 2300 to 2400, with a tick mark every 50 units. A point labeled 2329.48 appears between tick mark 2300 and tick mark 2350, slightly closer to 2350.

hints.content: Since $2{,}329.48$ is closer to $2{,}300$, it would round to $2{,}300$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 2300 to 2400, with a tick mark every 50 units. A point labeled 2329.48 appears between 2300 and an unlabeled tick mark representing 2350, slightly closer to 2350. An arrow moves left along the number line from 2329.48 to tick mark 2300.

hints.content: The amount of money rounded to the nearest hundred is $\$2{,}300$.

question.content: Alfredo asks his dad for permission to ride his bike to his friend's house. He tells his dad it is about $4$ miles away, but he rounded the distance to the nearest mile.  **Which could be the number of miles to Alfredo's friend's house before he rounded?**

hints.content: To help us round, let's place our answer choices on a number line.    [[☃ image 1]]  When rounding to the nearest mile, which answer choices round to $4$ miles?

images.alt: A number line labeled 3 to 5, with a tick mark every 1 unit. A point labeled 3.58 appears between 3 and 4, slightly closer to 4. A point labeled  4.4 appears between 4 and 5, slightly closer to 4. A point labeled 4.895 appears between 4 and 5, closer to 5.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\greenD{3.58}$ rounded to the nearest one is $4$, so $\greenD{3.58}$ could be the distance to Alfredo's friend's house.

images.alt: A number line labeled 3 to 5 with tick marks every one-half unit. A point labeled 3.58 appears between an unlabeled tick mark representing 3.5 and tick mark 4. An arrow begins at the point 3.58 and moves right to tick mark 4.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{4.4}$ rounded to the nearest one is $4$, so $\blueD{4.4}$ could be the distance to Alfredo's friend's house.

images.alt: A number line labeled 3 to 5 with tick marks every one-half unit. A point labeled 4.4 appears between tick mark 4 and an unlabeled tick mark representing 4.5. An arrow begins at the point 4.4 and moves left to tick mark 4.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\purpleC{4.895}$ rounded to the nearest one is $5$, so $\purpleC{4.895}$ is **not** the distance to Alfredo's friend's house.

images.alt: A number line labeled 3 to 5 with tick marks every one-half unit. A point labeled 4.895 appears between an unlabeled tick mark representing 4.5 and tick mark 5. An arrow begins at the point 4.895 and moves right to tick mark 5.

hints.content: The following are possible distances to Alfredo's friend's house:  - $3.58$ miles  - $4.4$ miles

question.content: Amber put gasoline into her car. She wrote down that she added $56.78$ liters of gas, but she rounded the amount to the nearest hundredth.  **Which could be the number of liters of gas Amber put in her car before  she rounded?**

hints.content: To help us round, let's place our answer choices on a number line.  [[☃ image 1]]  When rounding to the nearest hundredths, which answer choices round to $56.78$ liters?

images.alt: A number line labeled 56.77 to 56.79, with a tick mark every 1 hundredth unit. A point labeled 56.775 appears halfway between 56.77 and 56.78. A point labeled 56.782 appears between 56.78 and 56.79, closer to 56.78. A point labeled 56.788 appears between 56.78 and 56.79, closer to 56.79.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\greenD{56.775}$ rounded to the nearest hundredth is $56.78$, so $\greenD{56.775}$ could be the amount of gas Amber put into her gas tank.

images.alt: A number line labeled 56.77 to 56.79, with tick marks every 5 thousandths units. A point labeled 56.775 appears on an unlabeled tick mark representing 56.775. An arrow begins at the point 56.775 and moves right to tick mark 56.78.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{56.782}$ rounded to the nearest hundredth is $56.78$, so $\blueD{56.782}$ could be the amount of gas Amber put into her gas tank.

images.alt: A number line labeled 56.77 to 56.79, with tick marks every 5 thousandths units. A point labeled 56.782 appears between 56.78 tick mark and an unlabeled tick mark representing 56.785. An arrow begins at the point 56.782 and moves left to tick mark 56.78.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\purpleC{56.788}$ rounded to the nearest hundredth is $56.79$, so $\purpleC{56.788}$ is **not** the amount of gas Amber put into her gas tank.

images.alt: A number line labeled 56.77 to 56.79, with tick marks every 5 thousandths units. A point labeled 56.788 appears between an unlabeled tick mark representing 56.785 and 56.79 tick mark. An arrow begins at the point 56.788 and moves right to tick mark 56.79.

hints.content: The following could be amounts of gasoline Amber put in her car:  - $56.782$ liters  - $56.775$ liters

question.content: Julia is showing her sister how to make strawberry jam. She says  to use $3.5$ pounds of strawberries, but she rounded the amount to the nearest tenth.  **Which could be the number of pounds of strawberries before rounding?**

hints.content: To help us round, let's place our answer choices on a number line.  [[☃ image 1]]  When rounding to the nearest tenth, which answer choices round to $3.5$ pounds?

images.alt: A number line labeled 3.4 to 3.6, with tick marks every 1 tenth unit. A point labeled 3.42 appears between 3.4 and 3.5, closer to 3.4. A point labeled 3.46 appears between 3.4 and 3.5, slightly closer to 3.5. A point labeled 3.54 appears between 3.5 and 3.6, slightly closer to 3.5.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\greenD{3.42}$ rounded to the nearest tenth is $3.4$, so $\greenD{3.42}$ is **not** the amount of strawberries Julia uses for her strawberry jam.

images.alt: A number line labeled 3.4 to 3.6, with tick marks every 5 hundredths units. A point labeled 3.42 appears between tick mark 3.4 and an unlabeled tick mark representing 3.45. An arrow begins at the point 3.42 and moves left to tick mark 3.4.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]    $\blueD{3.46}$ rounded to the nearest tenth is $3.5$, so $\blueD{3.46}$ could be the amount of strawberries Julia uses for her strawberry jam.

images.alt: A number line labeled 3.4 to 3.6, with tick marks every 5 hundredths units. A point labeled 3.46 appears between an unlabeled tick mark representing 3.45 and tick mark 3.5. An arrow begins at the point 3.46 and moves right to tick mark 3.5.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\purpleC{3.54}$ rounded to the nearest tenth is $3.5$, so $\purpleC{3.54}$ could be the amount of strawberries Julia uses for her strawberry jam.

images.alt: A number line labeled 3.4 to 3.6, with tick marks every 5 hundredths units. A point labeled 3.54 appears between tick mark 3.5 and an unlabeled tick mark representing 3.55. An arrow begins at the point 3.54 and moves left to tick mark 3.5.

hints.content: The following could be amount of strawberries Julia uses for her strawberry jam:  - $3.46$ pounds - $3.54$ pounds

question.content: Jonas builds a snow fort. He  tells his friends it is $0.8$ meters tall inside, but he rounded the height to the nearest tenth.  **Which could be the height of the snow fort before Jonas rounded it?**

hints.content: To help us round, let's place our answer choices on a number line.  [[☃ image 1]]  When rounding to the nearest tenth, which answer choices round to $0.8$ meters?

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.7 to 0.9, with tick marks every 1 tenth unit. A point labeled 0.77 appears between 0.7 and 0.8, closer to 0.8. A point labeled 0.82 appears between 0.8 and 0.9, closer to 0.8. A point labeled 0.85 appears halfway between 0.8 and 0.9.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\greenD{0.77}$ rounded to the nearest tenth is $0.8$, so $\greenD{0.77}$ could be the height of Jonas' snow fort.

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.7 to 0.9, with tick marks every 5 hundredths units. A point labeled 0.77 appears between an unlabeled tick mark representing 0.75 and tick mark 0.8. An arrow begins at the point 0.77 and moves right to tick mark 0.8.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]    $\blueD{0.85}$ rounded to the nearest tenth is $0.9$, so $\blueD{0.85}$ is **not** the height of Jonas' snow fort.

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.7 to 0.9, with tick marks every 5 hundredths units. A point labeled 0.85 appears on an unlabeled tick mark representing 0.85. An arrow begins at the point 0.85 and moves right to tick mark 0.9.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\purpleC{0.82}$ rounded to the nearest tenth is $0.8$, so $\purpleC{0.82}$ could be the height of Jonas' snow fort.

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.7 to 0.9, with tick marks every 5 hundredths units. A point labeled 0.82 appears between tick mark 0.8 and an unlabeled tick mark representing 0.85. An arrow begins at the point 0.82 and moves left to tick mark 0.8.

hints.content: The following are possible heights of the snow fort:  - $0.77$ meters  - $0.82$ meters

question.content: Olivia is trying to get her friends to go swimming. She  says it is $95$ degrees to convince them, but she rounded the temperature to the nearest one.   **Which could be the temperature before Olivia rounded it?**

hints.content: To help us round, let's place our answer choices on a number line.  [[☃ image 1]]  When rounding to the nearest degree, which answer choices round to $95$ degrees?

images.alt: A number line labeled 94 to 96, with a tick mark every 1 unit. A point labeled 94.2 appears between 94 and 95, closer to 94. A point labeled 94.5 appears halfway between 94 and 95. A point labeled 95.2 appears between 95 and 96, closer to 95.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\greenD{94.2}$ rounded to the nearest one is $94$, so $\greenD{94.2}$ is **not** the temperature outside on the summer day.

images.alt: A number line labeled 94 to 96, with tick marks every 1 half unit. A point labeled 94.2 appears between tick mark 94 and an unlabeled tick mark representing 94.5. An arrow begins at the point 94.2 and moves left to tick mark 94.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{94.5}$ rounded to the nearest one is $95$, so $\blueD{94.5}$ could be the temperature outside on the summer day.

images.alt: A number line labeled 94 to 96, with tick marks every 1 half unit. A point labeled 94.5 appears on an unlabeled tick mark representing 94.5. An arrow begins at the point 94.5 and moves right to tick mark 95.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\purpleC{95.52}$ rounded to the nearest one is $95$, so $\purpleC{95.52}$ could be the temperature outside on the summer day.

images.alt: A number line labeled 94 to 96, with tick marks every 1 half unit. A point labeled 95.2 appears between tick mark 95 and an unlabeled tick mark representing 95.5. An arrow begins at the point 95.2 and moves left to tick mark 95.

hints.content: The following are possible temperatures of the summer day:  - $95.2$ degrees - $94.5$ degrees

question.content: Emma says the length of her favorite movie is $120$ minutes, but she has rounded the time to the nearest ten.  **Which could be the number of minutes of Emma's favorite movie before she rounded it?**

hints.content: To help us round, let's place our answer choices on a number line.  [[☃ image 1]]    When rounding to the nearest ten, which answer choices round to $120$ minutes?

images.alt: A number line labeled 110 to 130, with tick marks every 10 units. A point labeled 111.25 appears between 110 and 120, closer to 110. A point labeled 115.95 appears between 110 and 120, slightly closer to 120. A point labeled 124.9 appears between 120 and 130, slightly closer to 120.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\greenD{111.25}$ rounded to the nearest ten is $110$, so $\greenD{111.25}$ is **not** the length of Emma's favorite movie.

images.alt: A number line labeled 110 to 130, with tick marks every 5 units. A point labeled 111.25 appears between 110 and an unlabeled tick mark representing 115. An arrow begins at the point 111.25 and moves left to tick mark 110.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{115.95}$ rounded to the nearest ten is $120$, so $\blueD{115.95}$ could be the length of Emma's favorite movie.

images.alt: A number line labeled 110 to 130, with tick marks every 5 units. A point labeled 115.95 appears between an unlabeled tick mark representing 115 and tick mark 120. An arrow begins at the point 115.95 and moves right to tick mark 120.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\purpleC{124.9}$ rounded to the nearest ten is $120$, so $\purpleC{124.9}$ could be the length of Emma's favorite movie.

images.alt: A number line labeled 110 to 130, with tick marks every 5 units. A point labeled 124.9 appears between tick mark 120 and an unlabeled tick mark representing 125. An arrow begins at the point 124.9 and moves left to tick mark 120.

hints.content: The following are possible lengths of Emma's favorite movie:  - $124.9$ minutes  - $115.95$ minutes

question.content: A sign at a zoo says that their baby elephant weighs $200$ pounds. The weight was rounded to the nearest ten.  **Which could be the actual weight of the elephant before it was rounded?**

hints.content: To help us round, let's place our answer choices on a number line.  [[☃ image 1]]    When rounding to the nearest ten, which answer choices round to $200$ pounds?

images.alt: A number line labeled 190 to 210, with tick marks every 10 units. A point labeled 194 appears between 190 and 200, slightly closer to 190. A point labeled 198.13 appears between 190 and 200, closer to 200. A point labeled 203.4 appears between 200 and 210, slightly closer to 200.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\greenD{194.78}$ rounded to the nearest ten is $190$, so $\greenD{194.78}$ is **not** the weight of the baby elephant.

images.alt: A number line labeled 190 to 210, with tick marks every 5 units. A point labeled 194 appears between tick mark 190 and an unlabeled tick mark representing 195. An arrow begins at the point 194 and moves left to tick mark 190.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{198.13}$ rounded to the nearest ten is $200$,  so $\blueD{198.13}$ could be the weight of the baby elephant.

images.alt: A number line labeled 190 to 210, with tick marks every 5 units. A point labeled 198.13 appears between tick an unlabeled tick mark representing 195 and tick mark 200. An arrow begins at the point 198.13 and moves right to tick mark 200.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $\purpleC{203.4}$ rounded to the nearest ten is $200$, so $\purpleC{203.4}$ could be the weight of the baby elephant.

images.alt: A number line labeled 190 to 210, with tick marks every 5 units. A point labeled 203.4 appears between tick mark 200 and an unlabeled tick mark representing 205. An arrow begins at the point 203.4 and moves left to tick mark 200.

hints.content: The following are possible weights of the baby elephant:  - $203.4$ pounds  - $198.13$ pounds
